comment.body:
hey, could you look into adding scroll wheel support for zooming as well?
I feel like that'd be nice, although it'd have to be more granular than the right click to feel natural of course.
Great site though!
you didn't give any talks though, did you?

oh, and now that you're back.
Would you like to talk about zeronet on the lunduke hour in the future? It seems you have a few fans there and it would be nice publicity (which I think is the main thing zeronet needs right now)

@Nofish: let's hope for next year then!
regarding the lunduke hour, you'll have to organize that yourself. 
but here's some links to bryan lundukes social media profiles:
https://twitter.com/BryanLunduke
https://mastodon.rocks/@BryanLunduke
https://www.youtube.com/user/BryanLunduke
-
if you think I can help in any way please do ask :)

zeronet has this amazing feature that lets us configure it to use different directories, I have /var/log/zeronet as my log folder and /var/lib/zeronet as the data folder.
and zeronet itself is in /opt/zeronet/ .

So although I'm not 100% sure what your question really is about I'd say doing it like zeronet and having it default to it's own folder while allowing configuration would be about as good as it gets

@Rythyrix: should read from zeronet.conf
since I use the aur package zeronet is run with `--config_file /etc/zeronet.conf` but I don't think that's necessary.
here's my config file for reference:
```ini
[global]
data_dir = /var/lib/zeronet
log_dir = /var/log/zeronet

# ui_ip = *
# ui_password = anypassword```
I feel bad for you

hey, can you ping me about that once you release it? 
I'm quite interested :)
Hello, Sire
@Atheist: or duckduckgo, a search engine that doesn't spy

@Erneraude: it's hard to defend sites that are largely dedicated to illegal content.
Mostly because people will assume you use all of them
how people can live with less than 1 TB is a mystery to me :p

@Mkg20001: what the fuck are you doing with your drives lol

@Jayofthezero: same, I just want all the 6TB or so drives
it does kinda resemble it
using zeronet over multiple browsers just got a lot nicer

@Kaffie: the second statement is false, that would be freeware iirc.
the issue is that english does not have separate definitions of  "gratis" and "libre" but instead free to cover both.
I hope to see a vod of the talk! (assuming it will be in english)

@Nofish: on a side-note
is there a deduping process for images on zerome?
@Rythyrix: this is over bluetooth afaik, and if so definitely happens on android as well. It will however depend on what car you have since not all bluetooth systems are the same

personally I find that the only good work laptops I've used are t-series from lenovo.
kinda sucks but eh, most of their laptops are pretty good though I guess..
